sometimes I do have the same issue to deal with, here is how I deal with:
1/ rename the file to something else like Foo
2/ commit
3/ rename Foo to the old name with case sensitivity change
4/ commit
5/ squash commits

timeline.bodyText: rename to databaseMetadata() - I'm wondering if that should not be directly on SqlClient
timeline.author: vietj

replies.bodyText: Usually exposing such metadata is an internal feature for those users, I think it's better to keep the SqlClient API simple.
replies.author: BillyYccc

replies.bodyText:
The SqlClient is more focused on one-shot operations, whereas obtaining DB metadata isn't really a one-shot operation, it's mainly something that would make sense to obtain after you've obtained a connection (like in JDBC).
Also, I'm considering the new metadata class as an SPI, which also supports @BillyYccc 's comment about keeping it off of the "golden path" API usage
replies.author: aguibert

timeline.bodyText: I think I need to rewrite the parser sometime later as it does not consider the situations of different database version semantics.

replies.bodyText: Ok, at the moment it didn't seem like there was any MariaDB-specific code in the MySQL driver, aside from URL parsing.

timeline.bodyText: There're a wide range of database servers supporting MySQL C/S protocol such as Percona, Vitess, TiDB... and their reponse version strings differ much. Don't worry about this, I will fix this in another PR since the version string is also used to control the EOF header flag setting in MySQL.
